alert.note: Alert for Merrimack; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 6:53AM EST until January 05 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL IN SPOTS TODAY... .Low pressure will gradually move south of the Gulf of Maine today. Cold air will filter in from the north changing rain over to a light, perhaps intermittent, mix of freezing drizzle, sleet, and snow. It will not add up to much but will make for slippery travel at times. The western Maine mountains will pick up 3 to 6 inches of snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing drizzle expected at elevations above 500 feet. Total ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Merrimack and Strafford Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions at high elevations. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
